comment: had a writing assignment every 2 weeks, took online, learns lots
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment:
(Took Online Course)
- B so ready 2 read! Textbook + powerpoints
- IMO, topics were SUPER interesting! Learned a lot from them.
- Discussion posts, open quizzes, 2 open exams! Take it in on what U R learning
- Sweet + approachable professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I recommend this class with this professor for credit. The grading relies on a quizzes and discussions. While the topic is not my favorite, I learned a lot of valuable information, and the professor is kind and genuinely cares about her field. Take her!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This course was AMAZING! I highly recommend Professor Narty. She is so involved with the class and makes your education her priority. Highly discussion-based class, which has helped me learn so much from other students' perspectives. Provides a decent amount of extra credit opportunities as well. Such an insightful course, 100% would take again!

Online class has assignment and quiz every other week. Nothing is lockdown browser. Just play the work smarter not harder in the class and you will be okay. Use outside resources. It's easy you just genuinely have to try.

Wonderful Professor! You only need to buy one book for this class, lots of group work and informative lectures. She is a caring professor, She allowed me to leave class early because I had a class right after hers. I would take her again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: I liked that I learned a whole lot of stuff for real life. Once you attend classes and follow the resources she provides you're good to go. Not difficult at all....but missing a lot of stuff will def make it hard. Just stay on top and you'll be fine.
A great class to take. No regrets
My best class ever! 10 out of 10 minus nothing.

heavy on reading and weekly reflections regarding the readings with lots of group collaboration. she takes attendance, but the class is really not bad. no power point lectures, just her talking. grading criteria is not very strict as long as you put in your best thoughts. you do have to purchase a text book ($60 from bookstore and digital)

personally, i enjoyed this course. however, this course is homework heavy and the lecture notes are given orally rather than in powerpoint format. all the content discussed in this class was fairly interesting, but get ready for group discussion and readings.
A great class. Organized course structure. I loved the topics discussed.

Some of the texts are hard to digest. If not for her teaching, I would have had a hard time breaking down some readings. Her in-class activities are helpful and they hit key topics. Clearly, a student not interested in learning will term her approach as boring and unimportant. For me, I learned a lot because I was curious about the subject.

I was really looking forward to taking the course love and sex, because I had heard good things about it being an interesting and engaging class. She honestly made the class boring and took a lot of the interest out of it. There were things she could have done to make it more engaging, but it was mostly lectures about race and gender studies.
The class exercises are meaningful. She really does a great job breaking down ideas to my understanding. Makes me better appreciate the focus of the class.
She showed great interest in my learning. And I learned so many new stuff in this class.
She is super! Love this class....compelling.
She showed genuine care for my learning needs making me feel so motivated to show up and put in my best work.

Professor Nartey's prompt responses to assignments and my questions really enhanced my learning experience. Her approach allowed me to quickly address any issues and refine my understanding of the material. Her efficiency in providing detailed feedback was super helpful and meaningful.
I loved the structure of this class! My learning was highly supported. Don't miss class and the assignments and you should be fine. This was a group projects-heavy class.
Her teaching is relatable!

On the first day of class today, Professor Nartey immediately made a lasting impression with their engaging and dynamic teaching style. She created an inclusive and stimulating environment that encouraged open dialogue and critical thinking from the very beginning. Her passion for the subject is obvious. I love her approach already!

Professor Nartey was incredibly supportive throughout this class, offering invaluable feedback and guidance at every step. Her enthusiasm for the subject and dedication to my success were truly inspiring, making complex concepts much more approachable. I would take again.....super interesting!

Honestly, this professor helped me gain a great learning experience from this class. So many topics discussed in this class satisfied my curiosity. Not an easy A class like I thought but I made an A tho. The workload is demanding but I feel like the quality is worth it because it makes you come out of the course with solid knowledge overall.
I enjoyed taking this class! Interesting stuff and would take again.

I have learned a whole lot of great themes from this class. Keeping up with multiple homework was challenging but worth it because she gives good feedback. She has been a great resource to me by listening to my academic challenge in the class and suggesting possible ways forward. A nice learning experience!
Very organized. An easy grader but participation and class attendance matters for the most part.

Passionate about the subject matter. Breaks down concepts to my understanding. The class itself is not difficult once you show up and turn in assignments and participate in group projects. Always dealt with me respectfully. Gives credit for attendance. She is a sweet person and would take class again.
The professor is super professional and empathetic. Be ready to participate. Very fair with grading. Just do everything that is required of you.

Honestly this class doesn't seem very structured. The weekly homework assignments are basically just busy work and what we do in class sometimes seems pointless and repetitive. Don't get me wrong, the professor is a very nice person but her class was not for me.

Bless her heart, but this professor should've done some more work before teaching. It is an interesting class, but not with this professor. She had no freaking clue what she was talking about. She was repetitive as hell and also quite clueless.

If you want an easy A, go for it. If you care about learning, take a different professor.

She was a very boring professor and mostly only lectured. The class wasn't very well structured and she wasn't great about reminding us about deadlines. It's a very discussion post heavy class and all of the work we were given was just busy work. The class itself wasn't hard it was just repetitive which made it hard to follow.

She did not seem to really know what she was doing. She would ask us a lot of questions that were unnecessary and all of the homework was just busy work. The course overall wasn't very engaging either.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very sweet and new, open to suggestions. Textbook required. Teaches as if she just read the textbook the week before; we had to tell her the difference between Hispanic V. Latino. Group assignments and assignments weekly but easy if you have basic writing skills. Know how to navigate D2L because she can put in the wrong grade. Would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Accessible outside class
